SimplePointerType Class Reference

#include <SimplePointerType.h>

Inheritance diagram for SimplePointerType:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The simple pointer type is a pointer type implementation that displays one image at the pointer position, without any effects.

Definition at line 19 of file SimplePointerType.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SimplePointerType (  Image *  image,
Vector  hotSpot
) 
 

Creates a new simple pointer type.

Parameters:
hotSpot The hot spot is the position within the pointer image that corresponds to the pointer position. The pointer image is translated negatively by the hot spot offset to draw it at the current pointer position.
image The image for the pointer.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void draw (  DrawingContext &  context,
Vector  position
)  [virtual]
 

Draws the pointer at a given position.

Parameters:
context The drawing context that specifies the surface and clipping rectangle for the drawing operation.
position The position to draw the pointer at.

Reimplemented from PointerType.

Vector getHotSpot (   ) 
 

Returns the hot spot is the position within the pointer image that corresponds to the pointer position.

The pointer image is translated negatively by the hot spot offset to draw it at the current pointer position.

Returns:
The hot spot position.

Image* getImage (   ) 
 

Returns the image for the pointer.

The image for the pointer.

virtual void onPointerMoved (  Vector  newPosition,
Vector  oldPosition
)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handles the event that the pointer has moved, e.g.

by creating an effect. The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
newPosition The new position of the pointer.
oldPosition The old position of the pointer.
